text: Pavel Branko (April 27, 1921 – August 17, 2020) was an Italian-born Slovak movie critic, movie theorist, translator of fiction and non-fiction literature. He was called "the doyen of Slovak film criticism"."Nestor slovenskej filmovej publicistiky a kritiky" - See: Mariana Jaremková, "Filmovanie bolo pre mňa zážitkom," (Interview with Pavel Branko), in: Film.sk, No.11, Nov. 2009, pp.29.(ISSN 1335-8286. The printed version can also be checked online as a pdf.file.) - On the website of the International Film Festival Bratislava, Branko is also referred to as the "Nestor slovenskej filmovej kritiky" (the ‘Nestor’ of Slovak film critics). - Check the ‘external links’ section further below!).14th International Film Festival Bratislava: Hrdina našich čias (A Hero of Our Time) (Refers to Branko as the "Nestor of Slovak film critics"). He was born in Trieste, Italy. Many of his works focused on the impact of the history of Czechoslovakia. Branko died in August 2020 at the age of 99.Do umeleckého neba sa vo veku 99 rokov dostal filmový kritik Pavel Branko, ktorý mal svoje korene v Hačave ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2020 deaths Category:20th-century Italian writers Category:Slovak people Category:Movie critics Category:Translators
